title_slide.title: Aura Harvest: Reinventing Agriculture with Precision-Grown Carrots

slides.title: Farming's Big Challenges
slides.body:
• Traditional farming consumes 70% of global freshwater.
• Climate change threatens crop yield and consistency.
• Long supply chains lead to 30% food waste.
slides.image_prompt: A cracked, dry farm field under a harsh sun, symbolizing drought and agricultural challenges, cinematic and dramatic.

slides.title: A Smarter Solution
slides.body:
• We grow perfect carrots indoors, using precision agriculture.
• Our method provides year-round supply, immune to weather.
• We deliver superior taste, nutrition, and freshness.
slides.image_prompt: A pristine, futuristic indoor vertical farm with rows of vibrant green carrot tops under glowing full-spectrum LED lights, minimalist aesthetic.

slides.title: Our Growing Process
slides.body:
• AI-Optimized Nutrients
• 95% Less Water Used
• Zero Pesticides, Ever
slides.image_prompt: A detailed, beautiful infographic showing a cross-section of a high-tech vertical farming pod, highlighting water recycling systems, sensor nodes, and nutrient delivery tubes with glowing liquid.

slides.title: A Growing Market
slides.body:
• Total Addressable Market: $500B Global Fresh Produce
• Serviceable Market: $20B North American Organic Vegetables
• Obtainable Market: $150M Year 3 Target Revenue
slides.image_prompt: A bright, modern, upscale grocery store's produce section, with a focus on perfectly stacked organic carrots, filled with happy, discerning customers.

slides.title: Our Unique Value
slides.body:
• Yield - 300% more produce per square foot than traditional farms.
• Efficiency - 95% less water and a 50% shorter supply chain.
• Quality - Consistent size, sweetness, and nutritional value in every batch.

slides.title: Our Business Model
slides.body:
• B2B Contracts: Supplying major grocery chains with private label products.
• Food Service: Partnering with restaurant distributors and meal-kit companies.
• Direct to Consumer: Future plans for a premium subscription box.
slides.image_prompt: A professional chef in a high-end restaurant meticulously plating a dish, using a bright, perfect orange carrot as the centerpiece.

slides.title: Early Market Success
slides.body:
• Successful pilot programs with Whole Foods and Erewhon Market.
• Secured $500,000 in pre-orders from culinary partners.
• Waitlist of 20+ regional restaurant groups.
slides.image_prompt: A clean, minimalist slide featuring the logos of Whole Foods Market, Erewhon Market, and Blue Apron, arranged elegantly.

slides.title: Competitive Edge
slides.body:
• Grimmway Farms (Market Leader) - Water intensive, seasonal limits | Our advantage: 95% less water, 365 days of production.
• Plenty ($941M funding) - Focus on leafy greens, high energy costs | Our advantage: Specialized root vegetable tech, 20% lower energy use.

slides.title: Meet Our Team
slides.body:
• Dr. Alisha Khan, CEO - PhD in Agricultural Science from Cornell.
• Ben Carter, COO - Former Head of Operations at Driscoll's.
• Mei Lin, CTO - Ex-Amazon Robotics Engineer, IoT specialist.
• Javier Morales, Head of Sales - Led B2B partnerships at Impossible Foods.

slides.title: Financial Roadmap
slides.body:
• We project $15M in annual recurring revenue by Year 3.
• Targeting a 35% EBITDA margin through automation.
• Path to profitability within 30 months post-funding.
slides.image_prompt: An elegant, clean line graph showing steep upward revenue growth projections against time, with key milestones highlighted in orange.

slides.title: Our Funding Ask
slides.body:
We are seeking a $5M seed investment for:
• Facility Build-Out: Construct our first 50,000 sq ft facility.
• Team Expansion: Hire key engineering and sales talent.
• Securing Contracts: Fulfill initial large-scale purchase orders.

slides.title: The Future of Food
slides.body:
• Expand product line to include beets, radishes, and potatoes.
• License our proprietary growing technology to partners globally.
• Enter the European market by 2028.
slides.image_prompt: A world map with glowing nodes over major cities in North America and Europe, representing a global food-tech supply chain network.
